intro: Stenandrium wrightii, commonly known as Wright's stenandrium, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Melastomataceae and is characterized by its showy, clustered inflorescences. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial with opposite, ovate leaves. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, with five petals and prominent stamens. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
